docs.snippet: England manager Roy Hodgson already knows who he wants to take to the World Cup in Brazil and will not be influenced by a player's club form towards the end of the Premier League season, he said on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: England manager Roy Hodgson already knows who he wants to take to the World Cup in Brazil and will not be influenced by a player's club form towards the end of the Premier League season, he said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Hodgson Knows His England World Cup Squad
headline.print_headline: Hodgson Knows His England World Cup Squad

docs.snippet: England manager Roy Hodgson has ruled out making any late changes to his World Cup squad based on "last-minute form" in the final weeks of the Premier League season.
docs.lead_paragraph: England manager Roy Hodgson has ruled out making any late changes to his World Cup squad based on "last-minute form" in the final weeks of the Premier League season.

headline.main: England Boss Hodgson Unimpressed by Late Form
headline.print_headline: England Boss Hodgson Unimpressed by Late Form

docs.snippet: Paulinho is being tipped to be one of the standout players at this year's World Cup as his all-round strengths will allow hosts Brazil to take control of the midfield area as they chase a record sixth title, 1970 Cup winner Clodoaldo said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Paulinho is being tipped to be one of the standout players at this year's World Cup as his all-round strengths will allow hosts Brazil to take control of the midfield area as they chase a record sixth title, 1970 Cup winner Clodoaldo said.

headline.main: Paulinho Has All the Qualities to Shine at World Cup, Says Clodoaldo
headline.print_headline: Paulinho Has All the Qualities to Shine at World Cup, Says Clodoaldo

docs.snippet: Another player expected to play a role for his national team, Andros Townsend of England, will miss the World Cup because of an injury.
docs.lead_paragraph: Another player expected to play a role for his national team, Andros Townsend of England, will miss the World Cup because of an injury.

headline.main: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 43

docs.snippet: Marcos, the ever-present goalkeeper in Brazil’s last World Cup triumph in 2002, has backed his successor Julio Cesar and said his experience will be vital during the finals which start next month.
docs.lead_paragraph: Marcos, the ever-present goalkeeper in Brazil’s last World Cup triumph in 2002, has backed his successor Julio Cesar and said his experience will be vital during the finals which start next month.

headline.main: Marcos Backs Julio Cesar to Play Key Role for Brazil
headline.print_headline: Marcos Backs Julio Cesar to Play Key Role for Brazil

docs.snippet: The United States will stage a centenary Copa America in 2016 that could prove to be the seed for a true pan-American soccer tournament, officials said at the launch of the tournament in Miami on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States will stage a centenary Copa America in 2016 that could prove to be the seed for a true pan-American soccer tournament, officials said at the launch of the tournament in Miami on Thursday.

headline.main: Centenary Copa America Launched With Eye on Future
headline.print_headline: Centenary Copa America Launched With Eye on Future

docs.snippet: Paul McCartney's first concert in Ecuador was also his highest to date.
docs.lead_paragraph: Paul McCartney's first concert in Ecuador was also his highest to date.

docs.snippet: Top seeds Tomas Berdych and Milos Raonic strolled into the quarterfinals of the Portugal Open with straight-sets victories on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Top seeds Tomas Berdych and Milos Raonic strolled into the quarterfinals of the Portugal Open with straight-sets victories on Thursday.

headline.main: Berdych, Raonic Advance at Portugal Open
headline.print_headline: Berdych, Raonic Advance at Portugal Open

docs.snippet: The tournament will celebrate its centennial by expanding to 16 teams, including six from Concacaf, and playing outside South America for the first time.
docs.lead_paragraph: The tournament will celebrate its centennial by expanding to 16 teams, including six from Concacaf, and playing outside South America for the first time.
docs.abstract: Centennial edition of the Copa America, South America’s soccer championship, will be played in the United States in 2016 and include six teams from North America, Central America and the Caribbean; other soccer news noted.

headline.main: U.S. Will Host Expanded Copa América in 2016
headline.print_headline: Copa América Coming to the United States
